intro: Calydermos salmeifolius, commonly known as the silverleaf calyderm, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of reflective hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange, typically blooming during the cooler months. Its root system is extensive and adapted to store water, allowing it to survive prolonged dry periods. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, Calydermos salmeifolius is now classified as endangered.
